page.title: 15CUSTOMS
page.content: {Well Dressing}is our local custom in Derbyshire.You build a frame and put it in water for about 48 hours.Then you have to soften down some clay.You put it in a tub with water and stamp about in the clay with your bare feet. The clay is then spread on the frame . While the clay is being made soft, somebody else is preparing the drawing.The drawing is usually a picture from a Bible story.When the drawing is finished it is put on the clay and pricked with a pin so that the picture is pricked in the clay. Petals and moss and leaves are pressed in the clay using the right colours for each part, like yellow for the sun and white for the clouds.The petals overlap like tiles on a roof.
